title: Britons' passion for gardening to be used by ministers to sell the UK overseas to visitors
text:
Britons' green-fingered passion for gardening is to be used by ministers to market the UK to overseas visitors for the first time.

Helen Whately, the Tourism minister, will convene the first ever ministerial roundtable to discuss how the UK's gardens can be used to tempt tourists to come to the UK.

Gardening might be a national obsession and Britain's gardens such as RHS Wisley in Guildford and the Royal Botanical Gardens in Kew are world-renowned, yet there the Government has been slow to market the sector to foreign visitors.

The Government said it wanted to meet representatives from the leading gardens of the UK "to encourage them to identify opportunities for aligning marketing activity,...
